intro: Kadsura omeiensis, commonly known as the Yunnan kadsura, is a rare evergreen shrub native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family and is characterized by its unique, heart-shaped leaves and striking, hooded flowers. The plant is notable for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in Chinese herbal medicine. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
